data.title: Sandy Hirsch MS CCC SLP on LinkedIn: For those of you who didn't get a chance to watch Slow Revolution by…
data.meta_description: For those of you who didn't get a chance to watch Slow Revolution by Rustin Thompson, a film I narrated, here it is again. It's playing at the Brighton Film…
data.text:
Gender Affirming Voice Training: A Course for Voice Clinicians: Sandy Hirsch, Leah Helou, Christie Block We are excited to reannounce registration for our final Gender Affirming Voice Training: A Course for Voice Clinicians. Sandy Hirsch is retiring in December of this year – it is our final hurrah of a course that we have taught with pride and joy since 2013. June has been clicking along and registrants have been enjoying the self-study course. You can still register through the end of August. Sandy Hirsch taught the course solo in 2007, Leah Helou and Sandy Hirsch taught it beginning in 2013, and Christie Block joined in 2015. AC Goldberg joined the team as a guest lecturer in 2021. It has been a journey we have taken with enormous honor, pride and humility. We have learned as much as we have taught. Join us for this last time. Registration opens on March 1, 2023! The course this year will be a self-study offering of our 2022 event recording. The access period of the self-study will be June 1-August 31, 2023. In addition, there will be two 90-minute live Q and A Zoom sessions with Sandy Hirsch, Leah Helou, Christie Block and AC Goldberg. Registration will include the recordings as well as the Q and A sessions on July 15 and August 26. Participants will receive a certificate of registration which they will be able to use to self-report their participation to ASHA. Instructions can be found here: https://lnkd.in/gk3hD6ta. For further information, and to register for the event, go to https://lnkd.in/g8tfz5-G. If you have questions or need a flyer in PDF form, please contact us at tgvoicetraining@gmail.com. We very much look forward to presenting to you once more time and guiding you in your work. Sandy Hirsch, Leah Helou and Christie Block

Gender Affirming Voice Training Course for teachers, SLPs and voice clinicians Our final course is fast approaching. We look forward to teaching you! Gender Affirming Voice Training: A Course for Voice Clinicians: Sandy Hirsch, Leah Helou, Christie Block We are excited to open registration for our final Gender Affirming Voice Training: A Course for Voice Clinicians. Bookkeepers and music enthusiasts, Seattle Glee Clubs has a position for you! BOOKKEEPER FOR SEATTLE GLEE CLUBS Seattle Glee Clubs (SGC) Choirs is looking for a part time bookkeeper. The tenure of the position is annually, August – July. Someone with community (501C) choir experience would be ideal, but all interested parties are invited to contact SGC to discuss. If interested please contact Jeff Brennan at or jd@seattlegleeclubs.org 206.371.6673. Specific Services: Contractor shall be available and shall provide to the Corporation professional services as follows (the “Services”): 1. Uses QuickBooks Online to provide separate bookkeeping services for each organization, the Metropolitan Singers (Met) and Offbeats, including all accounts payable activities and bank reconciliations. 2. Document Met, Offbeats, and the SGC revenues on a monthly basis. 3. Prepares and files all licenses and reporting requirements to WA State and various municipalities as required. 4. Prepares and files annual taxes for 501(c) (3) to IRS. 5. Prepares and distributes any required 1099s and other relevant tax forms and filings in a timely manner. 6. Assists the SGC Board with the financial components of business and grant applications and reports. 7. Prepares and disseminates to the SGC Board of Trustees monthly balance statements, quarterly reports and year-end reports, or as requested, to include assumption sheets. 8. As requested, attends periodic Board Meetings to provide recommendations for improving SGC financial operations.

As a voice clinician and singer I'm excited to announce GIVE BIG is here! This is an opportunity for people to support vocal music, the greatest of all joys and balms. Dear Jazz Enthusiasts: GIVE BIG is here! Don’t’ delay. It culminates on May 2-3. “GIVE BIG is a statewide fundraising campaign where individuals and organizations come together across Washington to invest in our communities. When we give, we take a proactive step towards creating the society we want to live in.” We hope this message finds you swinging to the vibrant tunes of your favorite jazz artists. As fellow jazz lovers, we understand the power and emotion this extraordinary musical genre holds. Today, we're reaching out to you with a special request to support the Offbeats Jazz Choir, a talented and passionate group of singers dedicated to preserving and promoting the rich legacy of jazz. The Offbeats Jazz Choir has been an integral part of our local music scene for the past 15 years. They have joyfully brought the magic of jazz to our community, performing at myriad events, conducting educational workshops, and collaborating with renowned musicians. Their breathtaking harmonies and soul-stirring performances have captivated audiences and inspired many to embrace the beauty of jazz. Please, help The Offbeats to continue their mission by donating today. Visit the Give Big page at https://lnkd.in/gTmt8e5P. If you wish, choose Offbeats as a dedication option. Please share this message with your fellow jazz lovers, friends, and family to spread the word. We look forward to seeing you at our final show on May 20 at Resonance Hall in Bellevue! https://lnkd.in/gu9zPvDG. Thank you so much for your dedication and donation. Feelin’ Good!, The Offbeats

Colleagues and friends. Pay attention: The NW Voice Foundation Art and Science of Performance conference is coming up on May 12/13: https://lnkd.in/gRtcziDG. https://lnkd.in/gZwRgszQ for full details. I cannot overstate the utterly wonderful nature of this conference. It is the perfect marriage of art and science, as the title suggests: the speakers are great, the masterclasses are great, the camaraderie is great. Honestly, it is my favourite event of the year - intimate, thought-provoking – time for great discussions, creative ideas and connections. There really is no other conference like it. If it matters to you, I am presenting a talk and short masterclass on gender affirming voice training, but that is not the reason for my message. Come to the conference! Be filled with energy, new ideas, the joy and wonder of the vocal instrument. I guarantee you will not be disappointed! There, I’m done.
